Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery vessel, possibly a dinos; exterior, white slip: black-figure decoration consisting of siren and bird to right (hair, chin, neck, chest, wing and leg remaining of siren, tail of bird), with added red on feathers; below, wide black band. Inside reserved.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Modern inscription written in ink NAU 14' on break (accession number used in clay analysis). According to Dupont and Thomas (2006, p. 80,NAU14), the geochemical characteristics of the fabric point to an origin in the region of Teos.
Bibliographic references: Dupont & Thomas 2006 / Naukratis: Les Importations Grecques Orientales Archaïques (p. 78, 80, 82-83, fig. 1) (NAU 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.421)
